instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> -A Not powering ON
threads.message:
I am trying to track the voltages, Unfortunately, I couldn't find the right board view file, There are many on the internet, But those are not matching with my Board, I don't know why. Could someone help me? 
However, here is the voltages on different inductors (I hope the refdes should not be much different ).


L7095 - 3.417V (<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>)
L7130 - 1.66V (<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>)I dont know why
L7195 - 5.501V (<SIGNAL>PP5V1_CHGR_VDDP</SIGNAL>)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> -A Not powering ON
threads.message:
Two versions of this board on the market; only one schematic/boardview available.

Check diode mode to ground at F7140.
Post basic <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.
Also check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> -A Not powering ON
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> -A Not powering ON
threads.message:
"9 - 4.316V
-----------
Resistance btw 27 & 28 is 483K Ohm"
There is the problem.
Check <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 and traces...

threads.message: Both these resisters are open (<RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22  ) , Shall I change them ?
